EM.content: hégéliano-husserliano-heideggerienne anthropology (in France) concerned itself with the concept of history but not the history of a concept, especially concerned w/ we, nous-hommes, totality of human-reality
EM.linkedContent: hégéliano-husserliano-heideggerienne anthropology (in France) concerned itself with the concept of history but not the history of a concept, especially concerned w/ we, nous-hommes, totality of human-reality

EM.content: thinking of end of man prescribed in metaphysics, in thinking truth of man > difficulty today to think an end of man not organized by dialectics of truth & negativity, an end of man that’s not a teleology in first person plural
EM.linkedContent: thinking of end of man prescribed in metaphysics, in thinking truth of man > difficulty today to think an end of man not organized by dialectics of truth & negativity, an end of man that’s not a teleology in first person plural

EM.content: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism
EM.linkedContent: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism

EM.content: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme
EM.linkedContent: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme

EM.content: nous, we, arises (s’élève) [like ghost?] [out of the folds of the 2 ends of man: 1) transcendental end 2) finitude]
EM.linkedContent: nous, we, arises (s’élève) [like ghost?] [out of the folds of the 2 ends of man: 1) transcendental end 2) finitude]

EM.content: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)
EM.linkedContent: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)

EM.content: we (determined limit) is the means by which fact of Being is recognized
EM.linkedContent: we (determined limit) is the means by which fact of Being is recognized

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum ——nous, qui sommes, proches de nous-même, nous nous interrogeons sur le sens de l’être
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum ——nous, qui sommes, proches de nous-même, nous nous interrogeons sur le sens de l’être

EM.content: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being [chapter title: “Nous Lisant” pp. 123-36]
EM.linkedContent: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being [chapter title: “Nous Lisant” pp. 123-36]

S.content: the exemplarity of we, our we, is our Mitsein, discourse w/ ourselves and others, we who question/are questioned
S.linkedContent: the exemplarity of we, our we, is our Mitsein, discourse w/ ourselves and others, we who question/are questioned

OH.content: replace “I” w/ “we” > move from feeling to axiom
OH.linkedContent: replace “I” w/ “we” > move from feeling to axiom

AF.content: [re: Yerushalmi] monolinguist who says “we” promises secrecy for a virtual response [re: Freud’s unknown conviction that psychoanalysis was a Jewish science], does Freud’s ghost murmur the secret in private [to Yerushalmi]?
AF.linkedContent: [re: Yerushalmi] monolinguist who says “we” promises secrecy for a virtual response [re: Freud’s unknown conviction that psychoanalysis was a Jewish science], does Freud’s ghost murmur the secret in private [to Yerushalmi]?

FSW.content: we must be several in order to write, even to “perceive”
FSW.linkedContent: we must be several in order to write, even to “perceive”

DS.content: Hegel: curtain hanging before inner-world is drawn away, go behind it ourselves to see [curtain-raising of philosophical we, subject of absolute knowing]
DS.linkedContent: Hegel: curtain hanging before inner-world is drawn away, go behind it ourselves to see [curtain-raising of philosophical we, subject of absolute knowing]

POOF.content: who will have better represented than Nietzsche what is happening to our world, what is happening to us w/ possibility by affecting even the possibility of saying we?
POOF.linkedContent: who will have better represented than Nietzsche what is happening to our world, what is happening to us w/ possibility by affecting even the possibility of saying we?

ROP.content: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return
ROP.linkedContent: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return

ROP.content: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)
ROP.linkedContent: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)

ROP.content: untimeliness always disturbs the contemporary who reassures him/herself in a “we” > this “we,” our “we,” is not its own contemporary
ROP.linkedContent: untimeliness always disturbs the contemporary who reassures him/herself in a “we” > this “we,” our “we,” is not its own contemporary

RGE.content: [vis-à-vis Bataille’s paradigmatic displacement, never done before: Derrida’s simili-transcendental] “we” of absolute knowledge, vulgar & natural, naive consciousness: encloses itself in circle in order to know sense, where it comes from and where it is going to
RGE.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Bataille’s paradigmatic displacement, never done before: Derrida’s simili-transcendental] “we” of absolute knowledge, vulgar & natural, naive consciousness: encloses itself in circle in order to know sense, where it comes from and where it is going to

Gii.content: Geschlecht as idiom, a “we” that can hear Fichte’s address (not necessarily the Germans)
Gii.linkedContent: Geschlecht as idiom, a “we” that can hear Fichte’s address (not necessarily the Germans)

Gii.content: organic community in nonnatural, spiritual sense
“we” announces itself to itself from infinity of a telos of freedom/spirituality > engages, allies, promises itself acc. circle of this infinite will
Gii.linkedContent: “we” announces itself to itself from infinity of a telos of freedom/spirituality > engages, allies, promises itself acc. circle of this infinite will

Gii.content: for Fichte, “we” of Geschlecht, question of humanity (Menschlichkeit) (versus animality) > teleological essence of humanity announced par excellence in Deutschheit
Gii.linkedContent: for Fichte, “we” of Geschlecht, question of humanity (Menschlichkeit) (versus animality) > teleological essence of humanity announced par excellence in Deutschheit

Gii.content: acc. Heidegger, sciences belong to essence of technology, not to technology—to its essence; technology remains plunged in a fog (noyée dans un brouillard) > we still do not think (science, no one, is responsible for this) > the most thought-provoking (das Bedenklichste): we still do not think
Gii.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, sciences belong to essence of technology, not to technology—to its essence; technology remains plunged in a fog (noyée dans un brouillard) > we still do not think (science, no one, is responsible for this) > the most thought-provoking (das Bedenklichste): we still do not think

PIO.content: it is another “we” given over to inventiveness when mirror broken & tain crossed [re: “Fable”], a “we” that doesn’t find itself anywhere—not “we” of a community of human subjects
PIO.linkedContent: it is another “we” given over to inventiveness when mirror broken & tain crossed [re: “Fable”], a “we” that doesn’t find itself anywhere—not “we” of a community of human subjects

PIO.content: the other is always another origin of the world, and we are to be invented > beyond being
PIO.linkedContent: the other is always another origin of the world, and we are to be invented > beyond being

PIO.content: to invent the other is impossible, thus it’s the only invention: the invention that invents us
PIO.linkedContent: to invent the other is impossible, thus it’s the only invention: the invention that invents us

TR.content: “us”: those of us who find ourselves inhabiting this uninhabitable machine-event monster, who refuse to subordinate one to the other
TR.linkedContent: “us”: those of us who find ourselves inhabiting this uninhabitable machine-event monster, who refuse to subordinate one to the other

IW.content: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national
IW.linkedContent: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national

IW.content: “I” signs first in its spiritual language
for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity
IW.linkedContent: for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity

IW.content: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity
IW.linkedContent: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity

IW.content: Cohen suspects a narcissistic infatuation in Fichte’s national ego, mirror of a certain psyché, but also room for any other self in this national self, cosmopolitan logic, national self as “We”
IW.linkedContent: Cohen suspects a narcissistic infatuation in Fichte’s national ego, mirror of a certain psyché, but also room for any other self in this national self, cosmopolitan logic, national self as “We”

IW.content: “we” invoked as remaining to be constituted & presupposed as most originary
IW.linkedContent: “we” invoked as remaining to be constituted & presupposed as most originary

PJP.content: more than 1 voice in 1 voice, dispersion, threatens concept of perjury, threatens identity, threatens concept “I”; Schlegel’s “permanent parabasis of irony”
PJP.linkedContent: more than 1 voice in 1 voice, dispersion, threatens concept of perjury, threatens identity, threatens concept “I”; Schlegel’s “permanent parabasis of irony”

PJP.content: anacoluthon, generalized, causes all “subjects” to tremble (disturbance of identification), passes border btwn fiction/reality, btwn literature/testimony > even if erases border still a highly significant structural field: the duel of friendship, the question of “us”
PJP.linkedContent: anacoluthon, generalized, causes all “subjects” to tremble (disturbance of identification), passes border btwn fiction/reality, btwn literature/testimony > even if erases border still a highly significant structural field: the duel of friendship, the question of “us”

PJP.content: anacoluthon’s metonymy blurs/complicates all frontiers, instigates all substitutions
rapport (analogies of this rapport)—obscure alchemy that precipitates an “us”—in the shelter of/from (à l’abri de) some sober & inevitable perjury: we guard ourselves form perjury we inhabit
PJP.linkedContent: rapport (analogies of this rapport)—obscure alchemy that precipitates an “us”—in the shelter of/from (à l’abri de) some sober & inevitable perjury: we guard ourselves form perjury we inhabit

PJP.content: the “us” of the anacoluthon, not absolute knowledge, interrupts forever: no one says better, “we are not present to the truth of us” than the acolyte
PJP.linkedContent: the “us” of the anacoluthon, not absolute knowledge, interrupts forever: no one says better, “we are not present to the truth of us” than the acolyte

PJP.content: when we are present, truth’s not there; suivre/être [see ATIA]
PJP.linkedContent: when we are present, truth’s not there; suivre/être [see ATIA]

PJP.content: ultimate signature (last pages of book) says something of debt that remains unpaid > no scene of perjury w/out forgiveness
PJP.linkedContent: ultimate signature (last pages of book) says something of debt that remains unpaid > no scene of perjury w/out forgiveness

PJP.content: forgive me, we say to us
PJP.linkedContent: forgive me, we say to us

D.content: “we,” nonpersonal, limitless, imperfect: I, you, he cut out of a “we” never presented full face (de face)
D.linkedContent: “we,” nonpersonal, limitless, imperfect: I, you, he cut out of a “we” never presented full face (de face)

EL.content: “we” of covenant, not secularized “communal subject,” countersigns by responding to commitment already taken: autobiographicity of “we” assigned by call resonating from sacred language > in sacrificial instant, one hears imminence of God’s voice’s return
EL.linkedContent: “we” of covenant, not secularized “communal subject,” countersigns by responding to commitment already taken: autobiographicity of “we” assigned by call resonating from sacred language > in sacrificial instant, one hears imminence of God’s voice’s return

EL.content: Geschlecht and Schlag (stamp, imprint) > “we” that undergoes relation to itself out of (depuis) menacing interpellation of Geschlecht by apocalyptic speech (parole)
EL.linkedContent: Geschlecht and Schlag (stamp, imprint) > “we” that undergoes relation to itself out of (depuis) menacing interpellation of Geschlecht by apocalyptic speech (parole)

C.content: Cartouches, its singular performance (hapax, only once) simultaneously entitles & signs: I sign, therefore we sign cartouche(s) [m/f]
C.linkedContent: Cartouches, its singular performance (hapax, only once) simultaneously entitles & signs: I sign, therefore we sign cartouche(s) [m/f]

TN.content: for Nancy, touching is very experience of “origin” as “plural singularity” > being w/ (cum or co-), community as co-tact > se toucher soi-même, se toucher l’un l’autre ou les uns les autres [French grammar tolerates reflexive in singular & plural]
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, touching is very experience of “origin” as “plural singularity” > being w/ (cum or co-), community as co-tact > se toucher soi-même, se toucher l’un l’autre ou les uns les autres [French grammar tolerates reflexive in singular & plural]

TN.content: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world
TN.linkedContent: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world

TN.content: for Husserl, “we,” (who is this we?) immediately note difference btwn sight and touch
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, “we,” (who is this we?) immediately note difference btwn sight and touch

TN.content: Merleau-Ponty’s “it is a non-coincidence I coincide w/ here” can only be upset by thinking cum otherwise, w/ Nancy: “the other turns out to be the other of the w/”
TN.linkedContent: Merleau-Ponty’s “it is a non-coincidence I coincide w/ here” can only be upset by thinking cum otherwise, w/ Nancy: “the other turns out to be the other of the w/”

TN.content: law of parting/sharing at heart of con-tact: “inoperative community”
TN.linkedContent: law of parting/sharing at heart of con-tact: “inoperative community”

TN.content: Nancy: Heidegger and Husserl as 2 “styles of the essentiality of the with”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: Heidegger and Husserl as 2 “styles of the essentiality of the with”

EW.content: “we” of Dasein, we who are open to the question, to relation to self, to what is lacking in everything that’s not Dasein: this is analogous “logic” to what Heidegger sought to deconstruct
EW.linkedContent: “we” of Dasein, we who are open to the question, to relation to self, to what is lacking in everything that’s not Dasein: this is analogous “logic” to what Heidegger sought to deconstruct

EU.content: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies
EU.linkedContent: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies

EU.content: Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place
EU.linkedContent: Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place

EU.content: only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]
EU.linkedContent: only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]

SPEC.content: the contractual institution that permits one to say “je-nous” > Freud’s signature engageant et représentant tous les tenants de la théorie: ça marche et fait marcher comme ça [is Derrida speaking about himself too?]
SPEC.linkedContent: the contractual institution that permits one to say “je-nous” > Freud’s signature engageant et représentant tous les tenants de la théorie: ça marche et fait marcher comme ça [is Derrida speaking about himself too?]
